cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles E of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest tonight, then turning north-northwest and north along/near Florida’s west coast before accelerating north-northeast toward coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west-coast near the Big Bend (around Cedar Key/Tampa Bay area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from west of the Ochlockonee River to Indian Pass, FL (Gulf coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Florida Keys (Craig Key westward) and Florida west coast Flamingo to Ochlockonee River; Storm Surge Warning Bonita Beach to Aucilla River including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, entire Florida west coast, later coastal GA and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts in rain bands possible Tuesday into early Wednesday (overall 34-kt probability only 7%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on Atlantic side; surge threat confined to Florida Gulf coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher amounts, capable of urban and flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in squall lines and dangerous rip currents/surf along southeast Florida coast
